information.title: GHG classification
information.description: GHG Protocol: The GHG Protocol is a global initiative developed by the World Resources Institute (WRI) and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD). Its primary goal is to provide a global standard for accounting for and managing greenhouse gas emissions from human activities. In this, carbon emissions are classified according to:
information.s1: S1 or Scope 1: Type 1 carbon emissions are called direct. These are related to all activities controlled by the reporting company. Generally, field activities belong to this group.
information.s2: S2 or Scope 2: Type 2 emissions are those related to the generation of electricity, heat or steam that is purchased from a third party by the reporting company.
information.s3: S3 or Scope 3: Finally, type 3 carbon emissions are those remaining indirect emissions. These are related to the supply and production chain of the inputs that are acquired by the reporting company.
